extends Terminatable
    Version:
    24 may 2012
    Author:
    Jonas Schouterden (r0260385) & Nele Rober (r0262954) Bachelor Ingenieurswetenschappen, KULeuven

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Element(Position position, Board board)
      Initialize this new element with the given position and board if these are valid.

        public void setPosition(Position position)
                 throws IllegalPositionException,
                        java.lang.IllegalStateException

        IllegalPositionException - When he given position is not a valid position | ! (this.canHavePosition(position))

      • canHavePosition

        public boolean canHavePosition(Position position)
        Checks whether the given position is a valid position for this element.
        Parameters:
        position - The position to be checked.
        Returns:
        ... | if(this.getBoard() == null) then result == Position.isValidPosition(position)

      • canSharePositionWith

        public abstract boolean canSharePositionWith(Element other)
        Checks whether this element can share a position with another element.
        Parameters:
        other - The element where to this element may be in conflict.
        Returns:
        False if both this element is a robot and the other element is a robot. | if((this instanceof Robot) && (other instanceof Robot)) then result == false

      • takeHit

        public abstract void takeHit()
                      throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        When an element is hit (e.g. it is shot by a robot) some of its properties are altered. Which properties and to what extend, depends on the elements.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - When this element is terminated. | this.isTerminated()
